name: Mr. Ruesselo The Elephant
description: This is a knitting pattern of an elephant named Mr. Ruesselo. It includes a material list, abbreviations, row by row instructions, and photos.
full_text: This is a knitting pattern of an elephant named Mr. Ruesselo. It includes a material list, abbreviations, row by row instructions, and photos. Knitted in the round using the magic loop method. Legs and trunk are attached as you knit, and stitches for the ears are picked up and knitted flat. NO SEWING IS REQUIRED. SKILL LEVEL: Advanced beginner. USED TECHNIQUES Pinhole cast-on Turkish cast-on Backwards loop cast-on Knitting flat and in the round Slipping and purling stitches Increases (make one left, make one right) Decreases (knit two together, slip slip knit) Picking up stitches Three-needle bind-off Binding off MATERIALS REQUIRED Sport yarn (45-50g). 2 mm circular knitting needles 2 mm two double-pointed needles 3 mm crochet hook Darning needle Stuffing Stitch markers Scrap yarn to keep stitches on hold Scrap yarn in black for embroidery Yarn used for the yellow one: Drops Loves You 7 #28 (15g); Drops Safran #66 (30g) SIZE Approximately 23cm x 16cm. ERRATA Page 4: Put all leg sts on circular needles (not DPNs). Page 5: BODY&HEAD R43 only one repeat Page 6: BODY&HEAD R58 2 repeats of the sequence between the square brackets You may sell the finished toy, provided you give the credit to Svitlana Kondratova as the designer. You may not sell or share the pattern. Please don’t forget to tag your creations on Instagram with @im_strickfieber #MrRuesseloTheElephant If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me. If you want to thank me, please consider donating a little to my Homeland Ukraine. On the page of Friends for Ukraine you can find some volunteers, who demonstrate heroic humanitarian work, providing people and animals with food and medicines. Every donation makes a difference.
